title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 23 September 2013 - XWiki

08:48 <vmassol> cjd: good morning  
08:51 <vmassol> tmortagne: I have a very very basic markdown renderer started here (I started it for Emmanuel Bernard at some point to give him a skeleton since he was interested in working on this - but he's no longer). I wonder if I should commit the little I've done or if it needs to be complete before committing it: https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-rendering/compare/markdown-renderer  
08:51 <vmassol> (good morning too btw! :))  
08:52 <vmassol> (it could be labelled "alpha" if we wanted to commit it)  
08:52 <tmortagne> vmassol: +1 for commit with experimental or alpha or something like that like we did for xwiki/2.1 before we declare it stable  
08:53 <vmassol> ok I'll push something for 5.3M1 then  
08:53 <vmassol> after we create the RC1 brnach for 5.2  
08:53 <vmassol> thanks  
08:54 <vmassol> ah jakub has also started doing that, cool  
09:01 <UCC> has joined #xwiki  
09:03 <vmassol> tmortagne: you really deleted " remotes/origin/feature-resource-and-wiki-modules"?  
09:03 <vmassol> that's my branch and it's needed ….  
09:04 <vmassol> see XWIKI-9236

09:04 <tmortagne> I did not touched it  
09:04 <vmassol> you said "deleted" in your last email  
09:05 <vmassol> maybe you replied to the wrong line then?  
09:05 <vmassol> (which would be great! :))  
09:05 <tmortagne> was feature-restimportxar  
09:05 <vmassol> ok pfew :)  
09:06 <tmortagne> I checked all the empty branches (branches with no diff with master)  
09:06 <vmassol> yep  
09:08 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:24 <vmassol> sburjan/msmeria: good morning  
09:24 <vmassol> any blocker for the RC1 release of today?  
09:24 <vmassol> committers: anything remaining from any of you for RC1?  
09:24 <sburjan> vmassol: anything I know about is the issue GD reported abut the Upgrade All Wikis  
09:25 <sburjan> besides that, I did not found anything  
09:25 <vmassol> hm indeed, he's probably not fixed it, I think he wanted to disable the upgrade all wikis but I didn't follow this thread  
09:25 <vmassol> I think thomas said +1, who's supposed to do that?  
09:26 <vmassol> (the disabling)  
09:27 <vmassol> GD probably if he knows enough about the DW, maybe mflorea can help?  
09:27 <tmortagne> vmassol: no idea what is supposed to disable but Guillaume need to validate the proposal first (plus I'm the only one who voted)  
09:27 <tmortagne> s/what/who/  
09:27 <vmassol> yes would be good to have mflorea's opinion at least  
09:27 <tmortagne> I know how to diabled it don't worry about that  
09:27 <tmortagne> disable  
09:27 <vmassol> ok  
09:27 <tmortagne> it's more on my side than on UI side  
09:28 <vmassol> ok so we just need some more opinions and that's all?  
09:28 <vmassol> ah GD needs to answer you say, ok  
09:28 <tmortagne> just need to say "this proposal pass" I guess yes  
09:28 <vmassol> ok let's wait for him  
09:29 <tmortagne> anyway disabling it locally waiting for him  
09:29 <vmassol> ok :)  
09:29 <vmassol> btw  
09:29 <vmassol> I have one problem with activeinstalls  
09:29 <vmassol> (a small one)  
09:29 <vmassol> if you go to http://activeinstalls.xwiki.org/  
09:29 <vmassol> you'll see there are some 1.0-SNAPSHOT versions  
09:29 <vmassol> these are sent by sergiu and fabio  
09:30 <vmassol> because they built a product based on XE  
09:30 <vmassol> the problem is that we don't send a product name along with the version  
09:30 <tmortagne> you should IMO  
09:30 <vmassol> I'm wondering what we could send  
09:30 <vmassol> yes we should  
09:30 <tmortagne> send the while distribution id  
09:30 <vmassol> do we have that info somewhere?  
09:30 <vmassol> ah  
09:30 <tmortagne> ExtensionId  
09:30 <vmassol> ok good, you think they have  differentone?  
09:30 <tmortagne> you are extracting the version from it I guess  
09:30 <tmortagne> but you also have the id  
09:30 <vmassol> yes  
09:31 <vmassol> ok  
09:31 <vmassol> but will it be different for them?  
09:31 <tmortagne> EM is looking at the pom.xml so yes it should unless they do very weird stuff  
09:32 <vmassol> ok, I'll work on sending that now and commit before RC1 if you give me 1 hour  
09:32 <tmortagne> bu at least for Fabio I know he is doing it properly since he asked me  
09:32 <tmortagne> I'm not release manager so on my side you have all the time you want :)  
09:32 <vmassol> :)  
09:44 <vmassol> found a potential bug  
09:45 <vmassol> I've just built XE from sources  
09:45 <vmassol> and when I start it for the first time I get  
09:45 <vmassol> https://www.evernote.com/shard/s119/sh/f283dec5-9b90-4240-b8cd-83c37612fb92/52a43c9c27680df8f374ad7d4e07ab3d  
09:45 <vmassol> the AS is supposed to be empty  
09:46 <vmassol> anyone has any idea why there's this entry in the AS?  
09:46 <tmortagne> this is a generated class  
09:46 <vmassol> yes but not the only one right?  
09:46 <vmassol> yet only this one appears  
09:46 <tmortagne> it's not a class actually  
09:46 <tmortagne> a template  
09:46 <tmortagne> maybe the other are hidden and not this one for some reason  
09:46 <vmassol> good idea  
09:46 <vmassol> checking  
09:47 <tmortagne> but not sure why only now  
09:47 <vmassol> indeed it's not hidden, checking code  
09:47 <tmortagne> actually it used to be generated but I'm not sure it's still true after Edy's refactorings  
09:47 <vmassol> it's generated  
09:47 <vmassol> (can't find it in our sources)  
09:48 <mflorea> vmassol: on my side I just need to finish http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8535 . I'll reply to GD's mail.  
09:48 <vmassol> mflorea: ok thanks  
09:48 <tmortagne> looks like the sheet is in the XAR and the template is generated  
09:48 <vmassol> searhcing where  
09:48 <vmassol> if you know where, let me know ;)  
09:48 <tmortagne> wiki-manager  
09:50 <tmortagne> actually the the real code is in appmanager  
09:50 <tmortagne> AbstractXClassManager#checkClassTemplateDocument  
09:50 <vmassol> hmm I thought I had done fixes in there already  
09:50 <tmortagne> it's not set hidden by default but it never did  
09:50 <vmassol> maybe I missed this one  
09:51 <vmassol> wow:                 doc.setSyntax(Syntax.XWIKI\_1\_0);  
09:51 <vmassol> nice....  
09:51 <tmortagne> yes it's not recent code  
09:51 <vmassol> tmortagne: you want to fix the hidden or should I do it?  
09:51 <tmortagne> you can do it  
09:51 <tmortagne> continue working of DW  
09:51 <vmassol> ok  
09:53 <sdumitriu> has quit  
09:58 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
09:59 <vmassol> ok fixed and tested  
09:59 <vmassol> ouch big buf  
09:59 <vmassol> bug  
10:00 <vmassol> sburjan/msmeria: could you try this on latest:  
10:00 <vmassol> - log in as Admin  
10:00 <vmassol> - go to Admin user profile  
10:00 <vmassol> - change hidden docs settings to use and save  
10:00 <vmassol> this leads me to http://localhost:8080/xwiki/XWiki/Admin?category=preferences which shows an empty page for an unknown reason ATM  
10:00 <vmassol> missing bin/view  
10:01 <vmassol> yes looks like a bug regression

10:02 <tmortagne> vmassol: make sure you clean your browser cache, maybe some change in some JS

10:02 <vmassol> it was my cache  
10:02 <vmassol> pfew :)

Both links point to the same thing, but I think "view" should also be included in the first one

10:25 <vmassol> you're a user  
10:25 <vmassol> so it's easy  
10:26 <vmassol> do what I did: put yourself in the shoes of a basic user (ie hidden docs off, simple user)  
10:26 <vmassol> and if you something weird, you report it  
10:26 <vmassol> \*see  
10:26 <vmassol> pretty easy :)  
10:26 <vmassol> what I mean is you should report usability bugs

10:28 <vmassol> or using a "" action...

10:45 <vmassol> :)

11:55 <mflorea> vmassol: for the DW issue (upgrade all wikis mode) I talked with tmortagne and we'd like to add a new step that is triggered only when you select the Upgrade All Wikis mode, and that displays the list of UI extension (XARs) installed on all wikis so that the user (global admin) can upgrade the wikis. I think we'll need one more day for this, so we either postpone the release for tomorrow or do this for 5.2 final. I prefer to postpone.  
11:56 <vmassol> mflorea: postpone by the RC by one day seems better indeed. If we can keep the 5.2 final date FTM it's better. Thomas might need one or 2 more days if that's all he needs to have a first version of the new import though, he'll let us know  
11:56 <vmassol> in short: sounds good to me  
11:57 <mflorea> ok  
11:59 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: it might be necessary to update the translations on l10n too before the final 5.2 release  
11:59 <gdelhumeau> ok

12:00 <vmassol> which AFAIU is not correct right?  
12:01 <gdelhumeau> yes  
12:04 <vmassol> gdelhumeau: btw regarding your last commit  
12:04 <vmassol> did you deprecate the translation key too?  
12:04 <vmassol> if not, you should  
12:05 <gdelhumeau> ok

13:16 <vmassol> mf   
13:16 <vmassol> s/mf//  
13:52 <vmassol> any JS expert here?  
13:52 <vmassol> I need a trick to be able to put a string in a string in velocity inside a js file without yuicompressor choking on it :)  
13:52 <vmassol>         script: "$response.encodeURL($restURL)",  
13:53 <vmassol> more precisely:  
13:53 <vmassol>       new XWiki.widgets.Suggest(this.input, {  
13:53 <vmassol>         #set ($restURL = "${request.contextPath}/rest/wikis/${xcontext.database}/search?scope=name&number=10&")  
13:53 <vmassol> I cannot use a js comment since minification will remove it  
13:54 <vmassol> so I need some noop js operation that allows to put the following in it: irc://irc.freenode.net:6667/#set ($restURL = "${request.contextPath}/rest/wikis/${xcontext.database}/search?scope=name&number=10&")  
13:54 <vmassol> (bad paste)  
13:58 <vmassol> got it!  
13:59 <vmassol> :)

14:18 <gdelhumeau> how do we deprecate a translation key?  
14:37 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: you have some documentation at the beginning of ApplicationResources.properties  
14:37 <gdelhumeau> ok  
14:41 <vmassol> guys I'm fixing vnc on all agents  
14:41 <vmassol> there might be some false positives for a bit  
14:49 <gdelhumeau> tmortagne: should I create a deprecated section (with #@deprecatedstart) on a translation which is a wiki document ? (not in ApplicationResources.properties)  
14:51 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: yes would be better to follow ApplicationResources.properties, l10n wiki works the same for both  
14:52 <tmortagne> you can also add the ApplicationResources.properties header to your content  
14:52 <gdelhumeau> nice, ok  
14:54 <tmortagne> gdelhumeau: is this key older than 5.2 ?  
14:58 <vmassol> ok all done  
14:59 <gdelhumeau> yes  
15:12 <fmancinelli> Hi guys, do you know if the Job Module serializes requests to the same job type? E.g., jobManager.executeJob("A", req1); jobManager.executeJob("A", req2); jobManager.executeJob("B", req3); will execute A,req1 and B,req3 in parallel and put A,req2 in wait until A,req1 is done?  
15:13 <tmortagne> fmancinelli: there is no parallel execution yet  
15:14 <tmortagne> everything that go trough JobManager is executed on the same background thread one by one right now  
15:14 <tmortagne> (see http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XCOMMONS-400)  
15:15 <tmortagne> now for the serialization itself I'm not sure I understand what you ask exactly  
15:15 <tmortagne> a job status is serializer when it's done runnning  
15:15 <tmortagne> s/serializer/serialized/  
15:17 <fmancinelli> serialized in the sense that no two jobs of the \*same\* type can be executed concurrently. So if you ask to execute 3 requests of a job type A, these requests will be serialized in the sense that the second will start when the first is done, and the third will start when the second is done. A request for a job of another type can, in case, be executed in parallel  
15:19 <fmancinelli> anyway http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XCOMMONS-400 is even more strict, in the sense that there is only one job executing at a given time :)  
15:19 <tmortagne> fmancinelli: I can assure you it's impossible to execute jobs in parallel for now in job module, same type or not  
15:20 <tmortagne> yes even when you use executeJob  
15:20 <tmortagne> executeJob actually call addJob and wait for it to be done  
15:22 <tmortagne> fmancinelli: note that before XCOMMONS-400 I would like to evaluate XCOMMONS-443, it may completely remove this module or a big part of it  
15:23 <tmortagne> so if you feel like experimenting stuff you can look at it ;)  
15:23 <Inge-> hm. it seems to me that the code rendering macro is quite a bit faster now than it used to be.  
15:23 <Inge-> (i.e. 5.1 vs 3.4 or so)  
15:24 <fmancinelli> has quit  
15:25 <tmortagne> Inge-: we upgraded Jythong since 3.4 so might be it  
15:25 <tmortagne> Jython  
15:25 <tmortagne> and they were indeed supposed to work on speed but I did not really done much testing  
15:25 <Inge-> rightbut  
15:26 <Inge-> any change for caching it automatically?  
15:26 <Inge-> or does that still require wrapping it in a cache macro?  
15:26 <tmortagne> XWIKI-8456 is still open  
15:26 <fmancinelli> has joined #xwiki  
15:27 <tmortagne> ha something else, highligting used to be done 1 thread at a time  
15:27 <tmortagne> it's not true anymore  
15:27 <Inge-> yeah I just tested that  
15:27 <Inge-> that helps quite a lot  
15:27 <fmancinelli> sorry I crashed  
15:28 <tmortagne> when there is a lot of users yes  
15:28 <tmortagne> Inge-: if you fill like working on XWIKI-8456 I can give you some pointers  
15:28 <Inge-> well, if the rendering took 50 seconds, and everything else was waiting for it ... you didn't need very many users  
15:28 <tmortagne> 50s is really a lot  
15:29 <Inge-> a 200 line bit of code took a long time in 3.4  
15:29 <tmortagne> it took like 10s the first time it's used to initialize Jython but then I never saw it take 50s  
15:29 <Inge-> now it was down to around 10s  
15:30 <Inge-> and after wrapping in macro, it is <1sec  
15:30 <Inge-> i.e. caching macro  
15:30 <tmortagne> probably Jython for this one then  
15:30 <tmortagne> what syntax was it ?  
15:30 <Inge-> C#  
15:30 <tmortagne> ok  
15:41 <vmassol> gtg, bb in 1 hour
